div1.p: [Carter] returns some books and requests others.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to G.W. McCoy, January 23, 1925
div1.opener:
Book
Library
/LC
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
January 23, 1925.
Dear Doctor McCoy:
div1.p: The books you were so kind as to send me are ready for return.

I would be glad if you could get me:
1: La Historia de las Indias
by
Bartolomé de las Casas
Vols. 3 and 4
and
2: Historia general y natural de las Indias
by
Gonzalo Fernandez de Oviedo y Valdes
Vol. 3.

This last volume is possibly under the title:of
“El Libro de los naufragios y desadventuras.”

You might call the attention of the Librarian to the fact that
some of the leaves in the Oviedo returned are loose. None seem to be
missing and certainly none were either loosened or lost while here.

Again thanking you for the very great help you have been--and are--
to me, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Surgeon G. W. McCoy, Director,
Hygienic Laboratory,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
